jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Stay22

At Stay22, we’re revolutionizing how people convert online. Our AI-powered affiliate platform helps publishers, ticketing platforms, and content creators unlock new revenue streams while levelling up their audience's user experience. At Stay22, our partners don’t just earn more, they deliver more. Join us and be part of something big that's shaking up the affiliate world.

Position overview

At Stay22, we are pioneering the future of travel and content monetization with Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence. We’re on a mission to help content creators turn their influence into a powerful business, and we need a Senior Machine/Deep Learning Engineer to lead the charge. In this role, you’ll leverage cutting-edge technologies, build scalable ML solutions, and collaborate with teams across Stay22 to deliver insights and innovations that change how the world travels. This is not just a job - it's an opportunity to shape the future of travel technology!

Key responsibilities

  • Lead the development and deployment of machine learning models for forecasting and prediction based on tabular data

  • Harness the power of LLMs to enhance predictions and unlock new features for Stay22 products

  • Apply statistical analysis and data science methodologies to derive actionable insights from large datasets, always keeping an eye on optimizing user experiences and driving growth toward our key metrics.

  • Spearhead ML projects end-to-end, from conception through deployment, always exploring new technologies to stay ahead of the curve

  • Collaborate closely with engineering, product, and business teams to integrate machine learning solutions seamlessly into our ecosystem, ensuring that every ML initiative drives real business value

  • Contribute to building onboarding tools and infrastructure to make ML resources accessible across the organization, fostering a culture of innovation

  • Focus on creating low-maintenance, production-ready ML solutions, balancing the needs of scalability, maintainability, and rapid deployment

Requirements

  • M.S. in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Mining, Statistics, or related technical field

  • 6+ years of experience in Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field, with at least 2 years in both deep learning and software engineering

  • Strong expertise in developing ML models for tabular data predictions, with proficiency in Python and libraries like TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn

  • Strong Math skills, Python numerical libraries and SQL

  • In-depth knowledge of NLP, LLMs, Transformers, and modern ML techniques like CNNs, LSTMs/RNNs, and gradient boosting

  • Experience with platforms such as Google Vertex AI and Amazon SageMaker for training, deploying, and managing models at scale

  • Proven ability to implement and fine-tune LLMs, including expertise in custom embeddings, transformers, and fine-tuning techniques like LoRA

  • Strong data science background, including statistical analysis, data cleaning, and visualization with tools like pandas, matplotlib

  • Hands-on experience deploying machine learning models in production, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and ensuring seamless integration into broader product ecosystems

  • Passion for staying up-to-date with the latest in ML/DL and AI technologies and integrating them into real-world applications

What to Expect from our Hiring Process

​We know your time’s valuable, so here’s the quick rundown of what to expect.

  1. Screening call with our Talent Acquisition Partner (30-45 minutes)

  2. Collaborative coding session oriented on Machine Learning (Jupyter Notebook) with the Engineering Team (60 minutes)

  3. Final interview with our CEO (30 minutes)

  4. Offer & onboarding 🎉

Please note that this process is subject to change at any point, based on additional requirements from the team.

  • Lead with Impact: We empower our team members to take charge and make a real impact in the Stay22 universe.

At Stay22, our partners don’t just earn more, they deliver more. Join us and be part of something big that's shaking up the affiliate world.

Position overview

As a Senior Full Stack Developer on the Social Affiliate team, you will help build a new social monetization product from the ground up. This stream-aligned team is responsible for integrating Stay22's affiliate infrastructure with social platforms. In this team, we thrive on rapid iteration, experimentation, and creative problem-solving, using real user feedback to guide our direction. Requirements

  • B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or equivalent experience

  • 6-8+ years of experience in software development, building both backend and frontend systems

  • Strong backend development skills, particularly with Python (and familiarity with modern frameworks and cloud platforms like GCP)

  • Proficiency in frontend development, especially with TypeScript and modern web frameworks (experience building intuitive UIs and dashboards)

  • Proven experience integrating third-party APIs or SDKs; hands-on knowledge of social media platform APIs (YouTube, TikTok, Instagram, etc.) is a must

Position overview

As a Senior Full Stack Developer on the Phantom squad, you will play a key role in advancing our embedded widget and affiliate platform. Your mission will be to streamline browser execution and ensure high performance of our scripts across diverse websites. You will design mechanisms for privacy-conscious session tracking and fingerprinting, and take ownership of the full script lifecycle – from load optimization to event handling and error recovery. Working closely with product and engineering leads, you will help shape and maintain the core infrastructure that powers Stay22’s embeddable products, ensuring they run reliably under real-world constraints.

Key responsibilities

  • Continuously improve the load time and execution efficiency of our browser scripts (minification, caching, lazy loading, etc.)

  • Create robust methods for injecting content and widgets into arbitrary websites (e.g. automating DOM manipulation, handling dynamic page layouts)

  • Implement reliable client-side event handlers to track user interactions with embedded elements, ensuring accurate data capture

  • Develop and integrate fingerprinting techniques to distinguish and track user sessions across domains in a privacy-aware way

  • Build and maintain Node.js/Python-based scrapers to collect data from partner websites or APIs when needed; design fallback data sources for resiliency

  • Troubleshoot and adapt our runtime logic for real-world usage, including handling unexpected page structures or third-party script conflicts

  • Own the entire embedded product stack (scripts, SDKs, APIs) and collaborate with other teams to integrate updates and new features smoothly

Requirements

  • Deep hands-on experience with vanilla and ES6+ JavaScript or TypeScript without relying on frameworks (no React/Vue/etc. for core logic)

In this role, you will manage a talented combined team of 5-8+ engineers with diverse profiles, driving execution and delivery across both teams. You will balance people leadership with hands-on technical work - roughly 20% of your time will involve diving into code reviews, architecture discussions, and even coding small features or fixes. This hands-on involvement is critical for maintaining credibility and providing effective mentorship to engineers working on highly specialized and distinct technical challenges.

Working closely with two Product Managers, you'll translate an ambitious roadmap into actionable plans and guide your teams to deliver high-impact, scalable solutions. Reporting directly to our Head of Engineering, you will be a key member of the engineering leadership team - coaching and growing your engineers, unblocking complex technical challenges, and ensuring our platform's services are robust, scalable, and high-quality.

Key responsibilities

  • Build and manage a high-performing, blended team of engineers across the Phantom and Social Affiliate squads, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement

  • Adapt your leadership style to mentor and grow two distinct engineering profiles: deep systems specialists in Phantom focused on browser internals, and full-stack product engineers in Social Affiliate focused on AI applications and user workflows

  • Lead Agile ceremonies (sprint planning, stand-ups, retrospectives, and incident post-mortems) for your teams, continuously improving team workflows, communication, and productivity

  • Encourage a culture of innovation by identifying opportunities to leverage new technologies or process improvements that could elevate our platform, championing these initiatives from concept to implementation

  • Supervise the development of automated pipelines using Python on GCP and leveraging LLMs to analyze video content and identify affiliate opportunities

  • Guide the team in integrating with the Social platform APIs to retrieve and programmatically update video content, metadata, and transcripts.

  • Collaborate closely with the Hub team to design and implement seamless, user-facing workflows for social integrations, including UI components for linking accounts, reviewing analytics, and managing content

  • Oversee the end-to-end execution of projects, ensuring the timely delivery of features that meet quality standards and align with the goal of turning social content into commission-generating assets for creators

  • Set the technical direction for the company's browser-level infrastructure, leading architecture and design reviews for script lifecycle performance, DOM automation and iframe swapping strategies.

  • Lead critical technology decisions regarding privacy-conscious browser fingerprinting, session management techniques, and user identification systems that respect evolving standards

  • Ensure the health and scalability of core services by implementing best practices in testing, monitoring, and alerting. Proactively address tech debt and performance bottlenecks in our embedded scripts and networking pipelines

  • Remain actively involved in the codebase by conducting thorough code reviews, guiding architectural decisions, and occasionally writing code for critical features or bug fixes (approximately 20% of your time)

  • Collaborate closely with Product Managers and other stakeholders to refine requirements, prioritize roadmaps, and ensure engineering efforts are aligned with business goals

  • Act as the main point of contact for your teams when communicating with senior leadership. Regularly update the Head of Engineering on project status, technical decisions, and team progress, proactively managing expectations and surfacing risks

  • Manage key "X-as-a-Service" relationships with other engineering squads, such as providing browser-handling libraries to EmbedX, integrating with Neuro’'s redirect logic, and supplying performance data to the Data team

Requirements

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience)

  • 8+ years of experience in software development, with a track record of building scalable, reliable systems. At least 4+ years in an engineering leadership or management role, leading teams to deliver complex projects

  • A strong technical background in both domains. You are equally comfortable and credible discussing:

    1. Application & AI Systems: Modern backend development (Python preferred, Node.js), cloud platforms (GCP), building and deploying AI/ML solutions (especially using LLMs), and integrating with third-party APIs

    2. Low-Level Web & Browser Technologies: Deep expertise in JavaScript/TypeScript, browser performance optimization, DOM manipulation, browser security models, and networking protocols

  • Proven ability to lead, coach, and develop diverse engineering teams. You excel at mentoring developers with different specializations, from systems engineers to product-focused generalists, providing constructive feedback and helping individuals grow in their careers

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Comfortable collaborating with cross-functional teams (Product, Design, other Engineering squads) and translating complex technical details into clear, actionable insights for stakeholders
